experience.description_html:
Product Manager leading development and go to market of Syncron Data Platform and in general Analytics and Data Products, including:

• Syncron Enterprise Data Lake and Data Warehouse, including mechanisms of data ingestion, data processing and making data available to various consuming use cases
• Syncron AI/ML Platform based on Kubeflow, MLFlow, Jupyter Lab as well services provided by AWS platform
• Business Intelligence and Advanced Analytics solution - Syncron Insights

Accomplishments together with three great teams of engineers:
• Successful development and delivery of Syncron Insights – BI solution used by over 30 Syncron customers. Highly successful on the market and the first optional module in the history of Syncron that reached ROI within less then 2 years.
• Successful delivery of AI/ML platform, which became a core for all Syncron AI/ML use cases including Syncron Uptime (IoT), Syncron Price (customer classification and price optimization), Syncron Inventory (advanced forecasting methods).
• Successful development and rollout of Data Platform, used by multiple use cases – BI, AI/ML as well as established as a basis for re-architecture of Syncron software as a whole.

The responsibility includes:
• Create and communicate strategy for development and rollout of data platform and data products
• Create and communicate AI/ML strategy for Syncron
• Create and present to Management business cases for new initiatives related to data
• Create and communicate product roadmap to various stakeholders
• Jointly with Sales and Marketing define and execute go to market strategy
• Engage with third party suppliers on various topics including contract negotiation
• Manage direct reports of two Product Owners who in turn are leading three development teams
• Work closely with prospects and customers, participate in requirements workshops, presales activities, handling escalations.

name: Bastiaan ** G***t
about:
During my career, I have grown from a Software QA Engineer focusing on the testing of one product to broader roles as Product & Test Manager. In such a role, I also concern myself with the overall development & testing processes both within projects and products as well as companywide.

I like being involved in many aspects of a project, product and company as a whole, and I enjoy seeing the positive and meaningful impact our products have on our clients' daily work lives.

experience.description: At Cloudstorm Ventures I realized the stakeholder launch of a new cloud-based product in the veterinary services sector. I structured the project, implemented Agile/Scrum practices and led the QA effort. I worked closely together with the stakeholders to determine product priorities, set up the new system and ensure they could hit the ground running with our new product.My tasks were very diverse as I took on the roles of Product Manager/Owner, QA Engineer and Scrum Master simultaneously in a brand new and growing team. My tasks included:- Collaborate with stakeholders to align product vision and determine product roadmap- Work closely with data & system architect to design data model in Lucidchart- Work closely with UI/UX designer to design product UI in Adobe XD for both browser and mobile apps- Create user stories in Jira and prioritise them- Review and discuss these specifications internally and with stakeholders- Document the product information in a structured way on Confluence- Prepare upcoming sprints in Jira- Report on product progress in Confluence- Implement Agile/Scrum practices for this product and continuously evaluate & improve them- Prepare and facilitate Scrum Events and make sure everyone has a shared understanding of what Scrum entails- Report on past sprints in Confluence- Design and write test cases in TestRail- Set up and maintain test environment- Test the developed (software) solution, partly by running the designed test cases, partly by Exploratory Testing and Error Guessing. - Report bugs and perform initial analysis, discuss findings with developers and finally retest the issue.- Release management - Bug triage and support production systems- Train stakeholders and end users- Train additional QA Engineer
experience.description_html:
At Cloudstorm Ventures I realized the stakeholder launch of a new cloud-based product in the veterinary services sector. I structured the project, implemented Agile/Scrum practices and led the QA effort. I worked closely together with the stakeholders to determine product priorities, set up the new system and ensure they could hit the ground running with our new product.

My tasks were very diverse as I took on the roles of Product Manager/Owner, QA Engineer and Scrum Master simultaneously in a brand new and growing team. My tasks included:

- Collaborate with stakeholders to align product vision and determine product roadmap
- Work closely with data & system architect to design data model in Lucidchart
- Work closely with UI/UX designer to design product UI in Adobe XD for both browser and mobile apps
- Create user stories in Jira and prioritise them
- Review and discuss these specifications internally and with stakeholders
- Document the product information in a structured way on Confluence
- Prepare upcoming sprints in Jira
- Report on product progress in Confluence
- Implement Agile/Scrum practices for this product and continuously evaluate & improve them
- Prepare and facilitate Scrum Events and make sure everyone has a shared understanding of what Scrum entails
- Report on past sprints in Confluence
- Design and write test cases in TestRail
- Set up and maintain test environment
- Test the developed (software) solution, partly by running the designed test cases, partly by Exploratory Testing and Error Guessing.
- Report bugs and perform initial analysis, discuss findings with developers and finally retest the issue.
- Release management
- Bug triage and support production systems
- Train stakeholders and end users
- Train additional QA Engineer
experience.title: Product Manager

experience.description: At Prime Vision, a major player in the postal/logistics sector delivering Optical Character Recognition and System Integration solutions, I have been involved in various successful international projects. Among these are solutions for the Irish An Post and Deutsche Post DHL. During many high stress projects, I have proven myself not only as a Quality Assurance Engineer, but also as a Test Coordinator and Test Manager. I am a useful sparring partner for project management and take over certain (technical) project management and Scrum Master tasks as needed. I worked on projects using Agile and Scrum methodology as well as some using the classic Waterfall method. I have experience with customers that have their own test organisation or bring in a third party as well as clients who trust me to oversee the entire testing process. Mostly, I communicate with customers in English, but I am also able to converse in German or use my native Dutch.My tasks include:- Develop and write a Master Test Plan and any other required test plans- Review and discuss specifications internally and with customer- Perform a Product Risk Analysis with the relevant parties- Design and write test cases- Set up and maintain test environment- Set up and improve automated testing- Test the developed (software) solution, partly by running the designed test cases, partly by Exploratory Testing and Error Guessing. - Report bugs and perform initial analysis, discuss findings with developers and finally retest the issue.- Write test reports- Prepare, execute and facilitate Acceptance and Integration Tests at Prime Vision and on location (Site Acceptance Test)- Release management - Bug triage and support production systems- Train customer and write user manuals- Facilitate cooperation between project team and Prime Vision Services department- Supervise additional QA Engineer(s)- Improve overall (company-wide) QA processEmployed in this role Jan 2015 - Jul 2018 & Aug 2020 - Jun 2021.
experience.description_html:
At Prime Vision, a major player in the postal/logistics sector delivering Optical Character Recognition and System Integration solutions, I have been involved in various successful international projects. Among these are solutions for the Irish An Post and Deutsche Post DHL. During many high stress projects, I have proven myself not only as a Quality Assurance Engineer, but also as a Test Coordinator and Test Manager. I am a useful sparring partner for project management and take over certain (technical) project management and Scrum Master tasks as needed. I worked on projects using Agile and Scrum methodology as well as some using the classic Waterfall method. I have experience with customers that have their own test organisation or bring in a third party as well as clients who trust me to oversee the entire testing process. Mostly, I communicate with customers in English, but I am also able to converse in German or use my native Dutch.

My tasks include:
- Develop and write a Master Test Plan and any other required test plans
- Review and discuss specifications internally and with customer
- Perform a Product Risk Analysis with the relevant parties
- Design and write test cases
- Set up and maintain test environment
- Set up and improve automated testing
- Test the developed (software) solution, partly by running the designed test cases, partly by Exploratory Testing and Error Guessing.

about:
During my years as an IT Consultant I have worked for various clients across multiple industries, roles and problem domains. I see myself as a general problem solver, usually starting out in the developer role and taking on more roles as I grow familiar with the client.
My developer experience is primarily within the .NET-platform and C#, but I love learning and will embrace any technology or tool that enables my client to focus on their core business.
I believe that governance, best practices and people are more important than technology for achieving desired outcomes.
I have been self-employed since 2014 and I am primarily looking for opportunities that are compatible with this career choice.

publications.description: This thesis aims to analyze and capture differences and similarities in webbdesign between two countries, Japan and Sweden. The Swedish and Japanese websites of two companies established in both Japan and Sweden, IKEA and DAIKIN, have been analyzed based on a model devised by W√ºrtz (2006) in a previous study of the same topic. This model is in turn based on Hall and Hofstede‚Äôs theories on cultural differences and differences between so-called low-context cultures (e.g. Sweden) and high-context cultures (e.g. Japan). The model focuses on the use of animation, promotion of cultural values such as masculinity/femininity and individualism/collectivism, individuals being depicted together with products or not, level of transparency in the web design and finally linear vs. parallel navigation on the websites. Besides the study of the websites two interviews were held with a designer/developer from each company to get further input into how the companies think about their web design.
publications.subtitle: S√∂dert√∂rn University, School of Natural Sciences, Technology and Environmental Studies.
publications.title: Thesis about web design in Japan and Sweden

name: Tejas S****a * *
about:
An aspiring Applied Mechanics master's graduate.
Motorsport and Automotive enthusiast.

Interested in Aerodynamics, Thermal and Battery modelling, Multiphase flows, Fluid-Structure interaction, Turbulence Modeling, and Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD).

4 years of experience working in a diverse, fast-paced, competitive automotive-based company Volvo Cars as a CFD Engineer in low and high-fidelity simulations, wind tunnel & field testing using software such as Star CCM+, Ansa, Ansys Discovery, Python, Java and MATLAB.

1 year of experience as an Associate Software Engineer at Accenture after my bachelor's with particular knowledge in manual and automation testing using Java, Selenium, and SoapUI in an Agile environment.

Research publication in Springer on the final year project which I worked on during my bachelor's titled "Development and Fabrication of Smart Waste Segregator".
Research publication in Applied Sciences Journal on "The Knudsen Paradox in Micro-Channel Poiseuille Flows with a Symmetric Particle".

I am an extrovert who loves to make new friends and get along with them well‚Äîa team player who believes in being successful by helping his teammates succeed. I believe in luck, and the harder I work, the more I have of it.

experience.description: Project title: Numerical evaluation of particulate matter deposition in diesel particulate filters1. Numerically modeled and investigated the deposition of fuel particulates in automotive exhaust after-treatment devices (such as the diesel particulate filter) using micro-scale modeling approaches.2. The Direct Simulation Mont-Carlo (DSMC) method was used to simulate the behavior of rarefied gas in a micro-channel of a traditional diesel particulate filter.3. A private fork of the OpenFOAM toolbox mainly designed for simulating micro-and nanoscale flows.4. The post-processing was done in Paraview and special routines in python.Competences: OpenFOAM, Bash Scripting, Python, ParaView, OverLeaf Latex
experience.description_html:
Project title: Numerical evaluation of particulate matter deposition in diesel particulate filters

1. Numerically modeled and investigated the deposition of fuel particulates in automotive exhaust after-treatment devices (such as the diesel particulate filter) using micro-scale modeling approaches.
2. The Direct Simulation Mont-Carlo (DSMC) method was used to simulate the behavior of rarefied gas in a micro-channel of a traditional diesel particulate filter.
3. A private fork of the OpenFOAM toolbox mainly designed for simulating micro-and nanoscale flows.
4. The post-processing was done in Paraview and special routines in python.

Competences: OpenFOAM, Bash Scripting, Python, ParaView, OverLeaf Latex

projects.description: We numerically modeled and investigated the deposition of fuel particulates in automotive exhaust after-treatment devices (such as the diesel particulate filter) using micro-scale modeling approaches. The direct simulation Mont-Carlo (DSMC) method was used to simulate the behaviour of a rarefied gas in a micro-channel of a traditional diesel particulate filter. This project was carried out using a private fork of the OpenFOAM toolbox mainly designed for simulating micro-and nano scale flows. The post-processing was done in Paraview and special routines in python.
projects.title: Numerical evaluation of particulate matter deposition in diesel particulate filters

name: Muhammad S****b K**n
about:
PROFILE

An MSc in Electrical Engineering (Specialization in Control Systems and Automation) and B.E. Electronic Engineering, who is proficient, self-motivated and results-oriented individual with expertise in hardware and software applications. Technical skills include advanced knowledge of Automation and Controls protocol enjoys a challenge; Experience has been in a range of customer facing environment, requiring excellent communication at all levels and interpersonal skills and the ability to thrive effectively within a team as well as individually. An avid learner with good time management skills.

What am I looking for?

Multidisciplinary, innovative projects, challenging position in a leading, dynamic and career oriented organization where I can utilize my expertise of Control System, Automation and Computer Software and leverage my skills under a roof of pleasant, professional, constructive and inspiring environment.

What do I have to offer?

Besides my knowledge in Controls and Automation, I mainly bring in personal enthusiasm. In short my added value can best be described by always aiming for doing things that I believe in, doing things that make a difference, doing things that require top quality and doing it with people who have great fun in making it happen. For me, being a leader is much more fun than being a manager.

Generic skills

In random order: Good analytical and Problem solving skills, multi-disciplinary technical skills, inquisitive, creative, good mix of structured and improvising working style, willing to pave new roads, good presentation and interpersonal skills, agility in adapting to change, friendly, open communication, honest, team player, pragmatic, pro-active, flexible, market and customer oriented, committed to project goals, success driven, good project management skills.

publications.description: This paper is focused on modeling and introducing a new control strategy for a condensate water system. Current control strategy of the system is simple feedback control system with one PID controller. Results of current control strategy were taken into account for improvements in terms of system stability, valve movements and unwanted transients. Problems found in condensate system were; large variations in process variable, extra movement in valve positions and inefficient opening of valves. Simulation model with current control strategy and results as of real power plant was created and validated, as new control strategy can be applied and results can be compared. The main recommendation to improve the control system performance was found through PID cascade control strategy that could assist the current controller. The recommendation was evaluated by designing and implementing the cascade control strategy on the Dymola simulation model. Simulation results pointed out considerable increase in system performance according to the requirements of Ringhals (Vattenfall) AB Sweden.
publications.subtitle: International Journal of Innovation and Applied Studies IJIAS
publications.title: Modeling of condensate water system in a nuclear power plant with new control strategy using Dymola/Modelica

name: Karthik D*****j
about:
I work as a System Test Developer at Ericsson, focusing on Cloud Native 5G Core. 
I specialize in Ericsson Private 5G, Cloud Native Packet Core, and Digital BSS Solutions. 

In Ericsson 5GC, I'm involved in System Testing for Containerized and Virtualized solutions, XFT support,  Feature analysis and verification, Regression, Staging Monitoring, Integration, Configuration, and Test Automation.

In Digital BSS Portfolio, I was involved in Solution Architecture, System Integration, Consultation, Migration Studies, Solution Design (HLD & LLD), Business Configuration, Dry runs, and Live Data Migration.

My technical skills cover Unix/Linux, Ericsson Cloud, Containerization, Kubernetes, Docker/Containerd, Helm, Helmfile, CCD, Redis, ISSU, Geo-red, Prometheus, Grafana, Virtualization, VMware, Gherkin/Java, Shell Scripting, Expect, Oracle, SQL/PLSQL, Cassandra, Wireshark, JMeter, REST tools and more.

I have played a significant role globally in First Node Implementations and Support for customer-facing onsite projects. I've also managed Production Support and Escalation Handling, enhancing my problem-solving abilities. 
I have worked on Agile methodologies, especially Scrum and Kanban.

Ericsson Certified - Associate in Ericsson Cloud.
Ericsson Certified - Leadership Core Curriculum 2023-2024.

Outside the tech realm, I pursue interests in Portraiture, Chess, and Cooking.

projects.description: In this project an easy and efficient way of home automation is implemented with the use of AT89S52 micro controller. The micro-controller is programmed to continuously monitor a GSM module (Mobile Phone) for any SMS from the system user. When an SMS is received, it is processed by means of AT commands and the exact control word sent by the user is extracted for further processing. Communication between the GSM module and the micro-controller is established using RS232 protocol. And, for storing the control words, an EEPROM (AT24C08) module is used and is configured using the Inter-Integrated Circuit protocol.
projects.title: SMS based Automation and Home security system using AT89S52

positions.description_html:
Spearheaded the establishment of EasyPark’s presence in Slovakia and led the company’s strategic expansion in Czechia, including the successful acquisition of MPLA s.r.o. Played a pivotal role in creating favorable market conditions for service launches, navigating legal groundwork, and fostering stakeholder engagement. • 🎙️ Speaking Engagements: Represented EasyPark at conferences, panel discussions, and industry events, advocating for Open Market principles and urban mobility solutions.

🏆 Key Achievements:

• 🤝 Built strong relationships with stakeholders, enabling favorable conditions for long-term business success.

• 📈 Enhanced EasyPark’s visibility by speaking at industry events and engaging in thought leadership on urban mobility and digital transformation in parking solutions.

positions.description_html:

Led strategic development and execution to deliver market-leading solutions that aligned with business goals, customer needs, and revenue growth objectives.

• 📈 Optimized revenue streams by collaborating with commercial teams on pricing strategies, reducing leakage and focusing on long-term profitability.

name: Jochen W*******m
about:
Technology, Leadership and Social Relations are my three top passions in life.

After a career as a Systems Engineer and building a broad technical background in the mobile machinery industry, in process technology and embedded electronics, I progressed into leadership and team building.
My latest adventure brings me back, deep into technology, as a System Architect for the HVDC system at Hitachi Energy.

I am highly passionate about new technical developments, the people I work with and the community we live in. 

I believe in the bright future of open systems, open standards and open source and their application in 
data communication, control system architecture, user interaction design, IT security and Industrial IoT.

As a side project, I drive my own company providing web-hosting services and web-design development.

In 2007 I moved from my home-country Germany to Sweden, together with my family.

experience.description: Technical leadership in different areas of expertise throughout several development projects with the goal to maintain and develop the System Architecture of the MACH Control System.
experience.description_html: Technical leadership in different areas of expertise throughout several development projects with the goal to maintain and develop the System Architecture of the MACH Control System. <!---->
experience.title: MACH System Architect

experience.description: I drive the company Tinkerpod as a side-project, providing web hosting and web-related services to small and medium companies based on the Drupal CMS.Several servers at different European data centers are used to provide web-hosting services to more than 20 domains, mainly to private persons, clubs and small companies.Tinkerpod uses Drupal for leveraging flexible, dependable and extensible websites, from simple "business card" sites up to complete data management, shopping and booking sites.Tinkerpod was born out of enthusiasm for web hosting and internet technology, allowing me to continuously learn new things about this technological field.
experience.description_html:
I drive the company Tinkerpod as a side-project, providing web hosting and web-related services to small and medium companies based on the Drupal CMS.
Several servers at different European data centers are used to provide web-hosting services to more than 20 domains, mainly to private persons, clubs and small companies.

Tinkerpod uses Drupal for leveraging flexible, dependable and extensible websites, from simple "business card" sites up to complete data management, shopping and booking sites.

Tinkerpod was born out of enthusiasm for web hosting and internet technology, allowing me to continuously learn new things about this technological field.

patents.description: The present invention relates to an audio processing system for providing safe audio playback. An audio controller outputs an intermediate audio signal having a predefined test segment comprising a predefined test frequency component. An audio synthesis stage provides, based on the intermediate audio signal, an output audio signal for use in audio playback. An audio test is performed based on a first segment of the output audio signal corresponding to the test segment of the intermediate audio signal, and a safety processor declares correct the operation of the audio synthesis stage in case the result of the audio test is positive. The safety processor declares correct the operation of a frequency monitor if both the frequency monitor and a frequency-selective audio sensor detect the test frequency in the first segment of the output audio signal.
patents.title: Safe audio playback in a human-machine interface

about:
In the past 20 years I have had the chance to work with both research and development in  software and nanotechnology with teams covering the whole globe in particular US and China. 

I am a software engineer with experience covering the full stack from OS, drivers, middle ware to applications and user interfaces. I have a strong emphasis on embedded systems in particular Linux and Android. I like to be part of the whole product life cycle scope from design(architecture) & requirements to implementation,  testing and finally deployment.

My technology stack:
* C++, Python, C#, Java
* Software architecture
* Embedded systems
* Linux, Debian, Yocto, FreeRTOS, VxWorks
* Audio/Video codec & streaming
* Cloud (AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, Tekton)
* Problem solving
* AI (Tensorflow, OpenCV, Dlib, Keras)
* Mobile (Android)
* User Interfaces (Qt, HTML5, SVG, Javascript)
* MS Windows (VisualStudio, WEC , WIN32)
* CI (Tekton, Jenkins, TeamCity, CircleCI)
* VC (Git, SVN, ClearCase)
* HW: MIPI, CSI, Zync7000, i.MX8, i.MX51

projects.description: The VAriable Specific Magneto Plasma Rocket System also shortened to VASIMR is the next step of rocket engines going to be deployed for interplanetary travels. The goal for the project is to open up the possibility for a manned mission to planet Mars. The interesting thing with VASIMR is that it can reach tremendous high speed and at the same time be economical, that is, use propellant in the most efficient way. It is achieved by ionizing gas to a plasma and accelerate ions which generates the thrust.
projects.title: RF plasma ionization in the VASIMR ion propulsion rocket.

publications.description: UI (User interface) design for set-top boxes is quite different from other devices, for example: personalcomputer, where people mainly interact with device by using a mouse and keyboard, smart phone or padwhere touch-screen interaction is used. In this case user‚Äôs use a finger to operate the device directly. Theseinput methods are much easier compared to using a remote-control to operate a STB (Set-Top Box). This paper introduce some suitable steps/methods for designing a User Interface for remote controls and STB.

name: AJAY S****M
about:
As a Business Architecture Associate Manager at Accenture, I am the product owner for the Accenture Cloud Automation and Orchestration platform, a leading solution for cloud-based service delivery and management. I am involved with asset management and business development for the client deliveries, ensuring high-quality and timely delivery of cloud services and solutions.

I have over 4 years of experience in cloud deployment and support engineering at Ericsson, where I worked with product management, installation, testing, maintenance, and support of Ericsson Cloud Execution Environment, Ericsson Cloud Container Distribution, and Evolved VNF Manager. These products enabled network function virtualization, container orchestration, and dynamic configuration of routers for 5G networks. I have expertise in OpenStack, Kubernetes, vCloudDirector, and network function virtualization, as well as programming and digital signal processing skills.

I hold a Master of Science degree in Electrical Engineering specializing in Wireless Communication and Networks from KTH Royal Institute of Technology, where I exposed myself to the latest research activities in wireless communication and network, and contributed my knowledge for the good of the society. My goal is to leverage my education and experience to create innovative and impactful cloud solutions that enhance the performance and efficiency of wireless networks and services.
position: Business Architecture Associate Manager @ Accenture | Product Owner | Certified ServiceNow Administrator

projects.description: Device-to-device (D2D) communication is a trending topic in recent different research domains. This type of communication is very promising in dealing with cellular traffic offloading and energy efficiency. However, how multi-hop D2D communication between devices can more significantly save power compared to B2D and how the delay and packet size impact the energy consumption are the interesting issues that we focus on. This report focuses on downlink transmission scenario, where D2D is evaluated when a user requests a content that can be transferred from another UE within its transmission range. To evaluate D2D communications, we first introduce the system model that consists of three sub-components: mobility model, community detection model, and feasible path detection model. It is important to notice that the pre-statistical data to model the user mobility is based on the social aspect of the users. By following these models step by step, we make D2D communication possible and reasonable to enable at some given constraints. Then we do power consumption comparison between D2D and B2D, and further, analyze the impact of delay and packet size in multi-hop D2D links by running simulation experiments. The findings explain that D2D communication has a better energy efficiency though it would be affected by delay and packet size. For example, a single hop D2D transmission requires 83\% less power than a B2D transmission in a congested scenario.
projects.title: Social Oriented Offloading mechanism in xG Networks

projects.description: In present days, the applications like augmented reality, language processing, pattern recognition are increasingly dependent on mobile handsets. Because of the limited computational power of mobile handsets, the response time of any application may be too long for the user experience. Mobile cloud computing is one such approach which aims to extend the battery life time of mobile handsets thereby ensuring short response time. Mobile cloud computing allows to offload the computation viawireless access point to cloud that has sufficient computational power. Most of the computations arethen performed at the cloud and the results are conveyed back to the mobile handsets. This project was focussed on the modelling the cloud offloading taking into consideration mobile stability, cloud stability and the performance of the system.
projects.title: Mobile Computation Offloading

projects.description: This project is completely based upon interoperability between 3GPP LTE networks and WLAN. This projects include discussions on QoS, mobile protocols, Access Network discovery and selection function (ANDSF), AAA server, mobility scenarios between a 3GPP and non-3GPP access. My responsibility in this project was to cover the complete idea and design of ANDSF server , its function and its implementations. From this project, I was able to gain a complete knowledge over the mobile policies and decisions during the roaming scenarios, communication protocol between the user equipment and ANDSF server. With this knowledge we were able to present the ideas on ANDSF handover decisions and a complete handover procedure is presented in the paper.
projects.title: Interoperability between 3GPP LTE Networks and WLAN

projects.description: This project presents a comparative study of the decomposition of spatially inhomogeneous function using VMD and Wavelets. name: Farooq A***d
about:
During my more than 25-year technical job career from Developer to Tech Manager in my last job, my contributions to each role were immensely productive, vital, challenging, and results-oriented. Our team progressed from having no digital solutions to building a robust digital global ecosystem in multiple stages. Over the last year alone, I played a key role in 15 major end-to-end multi-project releases, contributing at every stage from product vision, business requirement gathering, and multi-layer implementation to final launch and operational execution. These projects showcased great versatility, including high-security solutions such as Identity and Access Management (IAM) and Authenticated/Non-Authenticated customer-focused platforms like the Mobile App, Web-based Mypages and Web-based sales solutions.
The major objectives of my work have always been to continuously expand my competencies by:
* Balancing Technical Proficiency and Development Leadership ‚Äì Ensuring a strong technical foundation while effectively leading development teams to drive innovation and efficiency.
* Driving Digital Transformation ‚Äì Spearheading initiatives that modernize systems, enhance digital * capabilities, and improve operational effectiveness.
* Setting Broader Strategies and Aligning IT with Business Objectives ‚Äì Defining long-term strategies that bridge technology and business goals to maximize impact.
* Strengthening Collaboration Between IT and Business ‚Äì Fostering seamless communication between IT and business units to drive alignment, agility, and shared success.
* Supporting Senior Management in Team Development ‚Äì Supporting leadership in building, mentoring, and optimizing high-performing technical teams.
* Identifying Opportunities for New Business Expansion ‚Äì Leveraging technology and insights to uncover new growth areas and enhance business scalability.

publications.title: NeuroLOG: A framework for the sharing and reuse of distributed tools and data in neuroimaging.

publications.description: Ontology design is an important process for structuring knowledge to be reused in different projects in the health domain. In this paper, we describe an ontology design for the collaborative knowledge building system ACKTUS to be used for developing personalized knowledge applications for different domains. Different foundational ontologies were compared with respect to selected criteria considered vital for the project, such as modularity and descriptiveness.
publications.subtitle: The 14th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence: Methodology, Systems, Applications
publications.title: Selection of Foundational Ontology for Collaborative Knowledge Modeling in Healthcare Domain.

publications.description: Abstract. Grid technologies are appealing to deal with the challenges raised by computational neurosciences and support multi-centric brain studies. However, core grids middleware hardly cope with the complex neuroimaging data representation and multi-layer data federation needs. Moreover, legacy neuroscience environments need to be preserved and cannot be simply superseded by grid services.This paper describes the NeuroLOG platform design and implementation, shedding light on its Data Management Layer. It addresses the integration of brain image Ô¨Åles, associated relational metadata and neuroscience semantic data in a heterogeneous distributed environment, integrating legacy data managers through a mediation layer.Keywords. Distributed Data Management, Relational Data, Semantic Data
publications.subtitle: Paris Health grid 2010
publications.title: Grid-wide neuroimaging data federation in the context of the NeuroLOG project.

Due to the constant and good exchange at eye level, also with UX Designers, this enables not only an efficient, but also very pleasant cooperation in the whole software team. If you are looking for a team player who also thinks outside the box and delivers high quality even under pressure, I can only highly recommend Yahya. I would not hesitate to work with him again as a QA Engineer or Technical Writer and wish him all the best for his future.‚Äù

Silvan Cloud Rath ‚ÄúYahya is a fabulous external colleague. Never felt like a service provider. Always deeply engaged in the business challenges we faced and always driving towards a great result for the business. One more fabulous experience we had with Arbisoft and the very special group of humans they have assembled! Thanks for the great time!‚Äù

projects.description: Raks&Roll is an application that serves the purpose of a virtual choreographer, with the ability to intelligently process music given to it as input and generate a well synchronized dance routine presented to the user in the form of a video. The input audio file is segmented and processed for the extraction of audio features such as tempo, beat timings etc. Different parts of the audio are classified on the basis of these features. Each audio segment is allocated the most suitable dance move from a variety of pre- learned dance steps. These dance moves are then combined to create an output video presented to the user.
projects.title: Raks & Roll

name: Aleksandr L*****n
about:
Hi, I‚Äôm Aleksandr, a Software Engineer with over 10 years of experience in software craftsmanship. My career uniquely blends 6 years of backend development with 4.5 years of mastering automated testing, giving me a deep understanding of both software creation and validation.

I specialize in Distributed Backend Systems and have delivered projects with real impact in FinTech and E-commerce. For example, I built a data pipeline with Google Dataflow to index 2 million products, which led to a 15% increase in purchase conversions for a major U.S. retailer with $4.9 billion in revenue in 2024. I also improved transaction processing for a NetSuite accounting platform integration, boosting performance by 5x for large transactions on a billing system handling $2 billion annually in 2022.

Beyond technical expertise, I bring proven leadership skills, having guided teams of up to 5 engineers and driven Agile development processes. For instance, I led the ‚ÄòSearch Accelerator‚Äô project for Michaels Stores (annual revenue of $5.8 billion in 2024), successfully and timely delivering features such as Autocomplete and Facets Business Rules, which significantly enhanced search functionality and improved the overall customer experience.

My certifications in Oracle (Java), VMware (Spring), and ISTQB (Testing) reflect my commitment to quality and industry standards.

What I enjoy most about technology is the endless chance to learn and explore. I love working with new tools, tackling tough technical problems and trying out creative ideas. It‚Äôs exciting to design solutions that improve systems, whether by delivering better business results or making user experiences smoother and more enjoyable.
position: Software Engineer | Java | Distributed Backend Systems & Microservices | FinTech | E-Com |  10+ Years in Tech

positions.description: ùêÑ-ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùêûùê´ùêúùêû ùêèùê´ùê®ùê£ùêûùêúùê≠: Search accelerator for the e-commerce domain based on Elasticsearch and Google Retail Search, used by the North American store chain Michaels Stores (annual revenue of $5.8 billion in 2024).ùêíùêÆùê¶ùê¶ùêöùê´ùê≤:In my role as a project technical lead, I was a key contributor to the 'Search Accelerator' project. This project not only provided significant value to the Michaels Stores client but also represented a pivotal part of Grid Dynamics' R&D Innovation department. Aligning with the GigaCube growth framework, the Search Accelerator underscored the team's commitment to innovation, one of the three main pillars essential to the company's strategic direction.ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùê´ùê¢ùêõùêÆùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß:Led a team of up to 5 engineers on the 'Search Accelerator' project for Michaels Stores, delivering timely and high-quality work, including unit testing coverage of over 75 percent. In my role as a project technical lead, I was a key contributor to the 'Search Accelerator' project. Aligning with the GigaCube growth framework, the Search Accelerator underscored the team's commitment to innovation, one of the three main pillars essential to the company's strategic direction.

Specifically, I designed the APIs and crafted the solution schema using Lucidchart.

positions.description: ùêÑ-ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùêûùê´ùêúùêû ùêèùê´ùê®ùê£ùêûùêúùê≠: Event-driven integration accelerator for e-commerce platform based on Apache Kafka.ùêíùêÆùê¶ùê¶ùêöùê´ùê≤:As the technical lead (up to 3 engineers) for the Event-Driven Integration Solution project, I played a pivotal role in this key R&D initiative. The primary goal was to gather product catalog data and inventory updates using an Apache Kafka-based solution, ensuring real-time data consistency and availability across the e-commerce platform. This project was in line with Grid Dynamics' strategic focus on innovation, showcasing the company's commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancements. ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùê´ùê¢ùêõùêÆùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß:In my capacity as technical lead, I steered the development of the integration solution pilot version, demonstrating its practical application and potential. This solution not only served as a testament to company's technical capabilities but also played a critical role in upsell strategy. I authored a comprehensive blog post detailing our project journey and insights: https://blog.griddynamics.com/kafka-composable-commerce-integration/

𝐄-𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐞 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭:
Event-driven integration accelerator for e-commerce platform based on Apache Kafka.

𝐒𝐮𝐦𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐲:
As the technical lead (up to 3 engineers) for the Event-Driven Integration Solution project, I played a pivotal role in this key R&D initiative. The primary goal was to gather product catalog data and inventory updates using an Apache Kafka-based solution, ensuring real-time data consistency and availability across the e-commerce platform. This project was in line with Grid Dynamics' strategic focus on innovation, showcasing the company's commitment to staying at the forefront of technological advancements.

𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧:

This solution not only served as a testament to company's technical capabilities but also played a critical role in upsell strategy. I authored a comprehensive blog post detailing our project journey and insights: https://blog.griddynamics.com/kafka-composable-commerce-integration/

positions.description: ùêÖùê¢ùêßùêìùêûùêúùê° ùêèùê´ùê®ùê£ùêûùêúùê≠ùê¨: Invoice Payment Method Integration with NetSuite accounting platform and Billing System Provisioning for an international telecom company (annual revenue of $2 billion in 2022).ùêíùêÆùê¶ùê¶ùêöùê´ùê≤:As a Senior Engineer on the project, I was primarily involved in Invoice Payment Method Integration with NetSuite accounting platform, Product Catalog Configuration and Billing System Provisioning for an international telecom company. I played a crucial part in transforming a prototype into a fully operational, production-grade solution, now serving thousands of customers daily. My focused efforts to enhance the system‚Äôs configuration flexibility and usability were key in driving a substantial revenue increase. Notably, during my tenure in the department (2017-2023), the revenue processed by the billing system quadrupled, reaching nearly $2 billion in 2022.ùêÇùê®ùêßùê≠ùê´ùê¢ùêõùêÆùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß:I played a pivotal role in improving billing configuration flexibility, significantly accelerating the time to market for new company services.Additionally, I optimised transaction processing flow performance by up to 5 times for the NetSuite integration service. I also led the migration of the Provisioning service from Dropwizard to the Spring Boot framework, substantially enhancing the overall service architecture and maintainability.Moreover, I took part into internal knowledge sharing sessions about Docker and Java Memory Consumption.
positions.description_html:
𝐅𝐢𝐧𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐣𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐬:
Invoice Payment Method Integration with NetSuite accounting platform and Billing System Provisioning for an international telecom company (annual revenue of $2 billion in 2022).

𝐒𝐮𝐦𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐲:
As a Senior Engineer on the project, I was primarily involved in Invoice Payment Method Integration with NetSuite accounting platform, Product Catalog Configuration and Billing System Provisioning for an international telecom company. I played a crucial part in transforming a prototype into a fully operational, production-grade solution, now serving thousands of customers daily. My focused efforts to enhance the system’s configuration flexibility and usability were key in driving a substantial revenue increase. Notably, during my tenure in the department (2017-2023), the revenue processed by the billing system quadrupled, reaching nearly $2 billion in 2022.

𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐛𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧:
I played a pivotal role in improving billing configuration flexibility, significantly accelerating the time to market for new company services.
Additionally, I optimised transaction processing flow performance by up to 5 times for the NetSuite integration service.
I also led the migration of the Provisioning service from Dropwizard to the Spring Boot framework, substantially enhancing the overall service architecture and maintainability.
Moreover, I took part into internal knowledge sharing sessions about Docker and Java Memory Consumption.

Dmytro Denysiuk (He/Him) üá∫üá¶ ‚ÄúAleksandr's performance has been exceptional, reflecting a high level of professionalism and leadership. He has significantly contributed to the project's success by demonstrating adept management skills in task organization and efficient work distribution. His proactive approach to enhancing our development processes, particularly in developing a solution architecture, refactoring and testing, has substantially increased both the speed and quality of feature implementation. His efforts in fostering a collaborative team culture have not gone unnoticed, leading to more efficient project execution and enhanced team dynamics. Furthermore, Aleksandr's involvement in corporate activities, such as the development of a blog post and a slide deck about our Composable Commerce Kafka-centric Platform, has effectively showcased our R&D achievements to external stakeholders. Looking forward, I encourage him to continue developing his leadership skills, especially in mentoring team members. This will not only aid their professional growth but also further enhance a team's capabilities. Additionally, exploring advanced project management methodologies and deepening his technical expertise in cloud platforms and search technology will be crucial in maintaining his competitive edge and driving innovation within a team. Keep up the great work, Aleksandr. Your continuous drive for improvement and commitment to excellence is greatly appreciated and valued!‚Äù

name: Gehan F******o
about:
With over 19 years of experience in software development, I am passionate about designing and delivering innovative solutions that solve complex business challenges. My expertise lies in developing robust, scalable, and high-performance applications for web, desktop, and mobile platforms using C#.NET, Python, and a range of modern technologies. I specialize in requirement analysis, feasibility assessments, and crafting architectures for distributed, multi-threaded, and multi-layered systems.

Throughout my career, I have successfully led globally distributed teams, mentored developers, and managed projects across the full software development lifecycle (SDLC). I take pride in consistently delivering high-quality software solutions on time, even in fast-paced and high-pressure environments. My extensive experience spans cloud computing (Azure), microservices architecture, and data-driven applications, helping organizations achieve their strategic objectives.

As a technology consultant and leader, I thrive at the intersection of technical expertise and strategic insight. I enjoy mentoring teams, shaping technology strategies, and leveraging emerging trends to drive innovation and deliver exceptional value. My commitment to continuous learning ensures I stay ahead of the curve, always ready to tackle new challenges with a problem-solving mindset.

Core Skills & Expertise
* Leadership & Mentorship: Managing and mentoring software development and consultancy teams.
* Technical Consulting: Providing actionable insights and solutions to meet enterprise needs.
* Backend Development: Expertise in C#.NET, Python, VB.NET, Flask, and PHP.
* Microsoft Technologies: Deep knowledge of .NET Core, ASP.NET MVC, WEB API, WCF, Xamarin, EF, Power BI, and ML.NET.
* Cloud Computing: Designing scalable and secure solutions on Microsoft Azure.
* Microservices Architecture: Building and implementing service-oriented systems.
* Database Expertise: Advanced skills in database design, development, and optimization using tools like MongoDB and Redis.
* Workflow Automation: Developing efficient workflows and business rules engines.
* DevOps Practices: Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, testing automation, and deployment strategies.

Why Choose Me?
I combine deep technical knowledge with strategic thinking to deliver impactful solutions that drive business success. Whether architecting complex systems, mentoring teams, or advising on technology strategies, I am committed to fostering innovation and exceeding expectations.

recommendations: Susanne Lam ‚ÄúIt is a privilege to recommend Gehan. Gehan is a technical expert‚Äîa brilliant programmer who thrives in solving complex challenges through elegantly written and highly efficient code. Gehan is the kind of guy who has been passionate about technology since childhood, constantly curious and eager to learn. Gehan stays ahead of the curve by consistently keeping up with emerging technologies and expanding his expertise in the field. On a personal level, Gehan's warmth and positive energy are contagious. He uplifts the office atmosphere with his humor and kindness, making him not just a colleague but a valued friend. As a senior team member, he has been an incredible mentor, generously sharing his knowledge and guiding me through many challenges. Whenever the team faces a roadblock, the advice is always: "Ask Gehan." I will miss having Gehan as a colleague and can‚Äôt help but envy the team that gets to work with him next. I truly hope we get the chance to work together again!‚Äù

Henrik Bj√∂rk ‚ÄúDuring my assignment as a Solution Architect at Volvo Penta, I had the pleasure of working with Gehan, a Cloud Engineering Consultant specializing in .Net on Azure. He is a hard worker who consistently delivered high-quality results at a rapid pace. Gehan's expertise in .Net is extensive. While working together, we engaged in numerous productive discussions on improving the product and making sound technical decisions. Gehan took a lot of initiative and made valuable contributions to the technical landscape. Needless to say, Gehan's contributions had a significant impact on the product. If you ever someone with deep knowledge about Azure and .Net, Gehan should be your go-to person.‚Äù

projects.description: I'm thrilled to share a project I‚Äôve been a part of the development and deployment of Uptime Backbone (UBB) and Notification Backbone (NBB) for Volvo Penta. These systems represent a big leap forward in smart connectivity and proactive maintenance for marine and industrial engine solutions. Here's what makes them game-changers:Uptime Backbone (UBB): The heart of operational excellence. UBB collects and analyzes real-time engine performance data, empowering predictive maintenance, optimized fleet management, and data-driven decision-making. It's all about minimizing downtime and maximizing productivity.Notification Backbone (NBB): The voice of the system. NBB ensures that critical information‚Äîlike alerts, diagnostics, or maintenance reminders‚Äîreaches the right people at the right time. Whether it‚Äôs a technician, operator, or fleet manager, NBB keeps everyone in the loop via customizable, real-time notifications.Together, UBB and NBB redefine customer experiences by enhancing reliability, reducing unplanned downtime, and empowering users with actionable insights. These systems are a testament to the power of connectivity and innovation in industrial and marine technology.
projects.title: Uptime Backbone (UBB) & Notification Backbone (NBB)

projects.description: GS provides a comprehensive solution for Open Source Intelligence, Web Intelligence, and Social Listening. The system allows investigators to collect information on suspects and targets, enrich existing databases and draw analytical insights from open-source information. The system is able to crawl data from multiple sources including deep web, dark web, and social media sites. An avatar management system allows furthering the reach of the system into closed networks and forums.
projects.title: GS Crawler

projects.description: Fusion is a multisource big data investigation platform. Ingest data from a myriad of sources, structured and unstructured, and apply custom analytical workflows and adaptable machine learning models to accelerate investigations. Break the silos and connect the dots to find insights and hidden links. Fusion helps track targets using multiple sensors and capabilities creating a single holistic profile of the target. It allows analysts to seamlessly move between web-based sources, SIGINT and interception, and collection capabilities from end-user devices such as mobile phones.
projects.title: GS Fusion

projects.description: ATP is a critical aircraft maintenance information. Whether in the office, at a remote location, or on the other side of the airport, the ATP Aviation Hub‚Ñ¢ mobile application makes the information available ‚Äì even when there is no internet connection. With this mobile application easy to maintenance regulatory information as well as critical compliance tracking information whenever and wherever they need it. Mobile Applications can be installed on Windows, Android, or iOS devices to access critical maintenance and regulatory content.
projects.title: ATP - Aviation Hub Mobile Application

projects.description: SKY12 School Management System is a comprehensive web-based product that automates all major aspects of school management. The system is hosted in SaaS platform, facilitating schools to make use of the system, which is delivered over the web, rather than building and maintaining infrastructure to run on-premises applications. This enables users to lower their costs by paying only for what they use, enjoy seamless and painless upgrades in functionality, easy customization, integration to tab applications and their existing data and systems. It comprises of nine modules as Admin, Planning, Staff, Student, Exam, Timetable, Attendance, Reporting and Parent-Student Portal. Admin Module is the central controller of the system where the Super Administrator of the School network can perform all system administrative tasks, including creating user roles, assigning privileges to user roles, user management, creating schools, etc. Planning Module involves the arrangement of the entire school structure. It includes all school configuration tasks, organizing the school calendar for a given academic year, and managing subjects. Staff Module facilitates the management of both academic and non-academic staff members of the school including a Subject allocation for teachers. Student Module facilitates the management of student registration, Disciplinary procedures, Student health, and Annual class allocation of students. Exam module includes organizing the Examination Schedules, Resource allocation, and Student Assessment. The timetable module offers a complete automated solution for constructing and managing the school timetable. Attendance module facilitates the management of both Student and Staff attendance, Synchronization with any existing attendance tracking system at school, and Leave management.
projects.title: SKY12

projects.description: Lilitha College (Lilitha) of Nursing has been established through the Education and Training of Nurses and Midwives Act 4 of 2003. The Inception of the college was in April 2004 and it has five (5) main campuses and thirteen satellite campuses.Lilitha has decided to take the lead in moving to a next-generation technology solution to further automate and enhance its procedures used in the capture, organization, and workflow of the extensive information that it must regularly process in University Management operation. In order to facilitate this requirement VIDLO Lilitha product has been developed which has the capability of automating and managing All operations, which are involved in running universities and colleges. The application combines a suite of applications specifically designed to bring together people, process, and technology towards improving relevance and quality of higher education. The product has different modules such as Finance, Student management, Academic Management, Examinations, and Student Portal, etc.The product has been developed as an ASP.net application and used SQL Server 2008 (R2) as the database server.
projects.title: University Management System for Lilitha Nursing College

projects.description: The Leap project was the proposed solution for Imprima to upgrade their existing Online Document Management System. The existing system was based on Classic ASP and was to be upgraded to ASP .NET using the 3.5 Framework. The system was to handle all the existing functions which were uploading and downloading documents, grouping, protection, compression, streaming and access control
projects.title: Imprima - iRooms (Online Virtual Data Rooms)

projects.description: System for RAS division to maintain documents of staff (passport scanned copies; degree certificates scanned copies etc.). The application facilitates quick search, sharing files and documents, and recover documents.
projects.title: Document Management System (DMS)

projects.description: This system provides a comprehensive solution for Insurance Brokering Companies with exclusive features, targeted for standardizing and streamlining the Insurance Broker‚Äôs operations. The system takes into consideration that the source of income for an Insurance Broker is through Commissions paid by the Insurance Company. Therefore the system keeps track of the effect to the commission during each transaction based on a policy. Taking into consideration the most frequent business handled by this system is Motor Insurance Policy; the system provides greater emphasis on the Motor Insurance related activities. But it provides generalized and highly customizable functions to undertake Non-Motor Insurance Policies as effectively as it handles Motor Policy activities.
projects.title: Insurance Brokering System with Finance (BSF)

projects.description: This system was developed for auto spare part vendors; it can handle stock management for multiple companies, the daily buying and selling values and re-order level can be checked by this system. One of the key features of the system is that it has the ability to generate a vast array of reports to be viewed by the management and the ability to generate real-time reports as all transactions are carried out online.
projects.title: Inventory Management and Stock Control System

projects.description: This system was developed for newspaper agents. The returned number of newspapers, the number of newspapers currently in stock, the total price of newspapers, the number of newspapers that will sell during the coming week and the ability for the agent to interact with multiple newspaper companies, are the main features of the system. The neural network capability in the system allows the agent to decide about the stocks that need to be purchased for the coming week. The traditional waterfall method was used throughout this project as the development methodology.
projects.title: Invoice System for Newspaper Dealers

recommendations: Thim Otskov ‚ÄúRohit and I have worked together since 2016 when he joined our team in Link√∂ping as Business Analyst focusing on capturing customer input and market trends. Rohit masters working at both the high and broader level as well as the deeper levels and he has time after time demonstrated his talent by guiding customers through often quite complex aspects of their requirements to a successful conclusion with a clear view of the broader picture. Working with Rohit on analyzing market trends is benefiting from his eye for both high and low levels. Rohit has also demonstrated his talent as a Product Owner, successfully facilitating several Agile Scrum Teams simultaneously. He is a strong contributor to our team and just gets things done.‚Äù

Stephanie Erickson ‚ÄúI worked with Rohit for several years when I was a Product Manager at Infor. I cannot speak highly enough of working with Rohit as a Business Analyst. He was able to dive deep into very complex requirements, and document and summarize them appropriately for different audiences - designers, customers, developers, and product management. He is very skilled at facilitating requirement analysis sessions with all of these different groups. He is able to research effectively and is very detail-oriented. He is very pro-active in identifying challenges early on in the design process and working to resolve those challenges in a positive way. He also offered very helpful suggestions on how we could improve our requirements documentation process, which we successfully implemented. I hope to have the opportunity to work with Rohit again in the future, he's one of the best!‚Äù

about:
* Manager/entrepreneur/one-man orchestra. Magnus founded TDialog (secure messages for private and public sector) 2017 and brought her to a profitable on-premises SaaS with 50 Swedish municipalities as customers when she was sold four years later. This was done with Magnus performing all management roles, sales, tech sales and Lead Developer.

* Programming/Tech/Information and IT security. With an MSc in Computer Engineering in combination with 20+ years of development experience and 10+ years of information and IT security, all the time being customer facing, Magnus has a very thorough understanding of the challenges facing organisations in different sectors today and the technical tools available to address those challenges. Magnus is a CISSP (Certified Information System Security Professional).

* Training/Tech Sales. Magnus' combination of technical, business and people skills have meant that he is frequently working in sales-oriented projects. Magnus' work is always oriented towards providing the best value for the customer. Magnus has extensive experience performing technical training, designing course material etc, as well as performing demonstrations and getting technical information out to customers of varying technical skills and backgrounds. He has 20+ years of professional experience as a trainer, with several hundred training courses performed (ranging from 1 to 3 days), as well as 15+ years of professional experience doing Tech Sales.

* Public speaker. Magnus is a regular speaker and a bit of an evangelist at Public Sector events in Sweden, mainly preaching collaborative information security.

name: Joris R******s
about:
After completing my studies, I made the bold decision to move from the Netherlands to Sweden. Having already studied in Sweden for 6 months, I knew my international journey wasn‚Äôt over. I wanted to gain global work experience, immerse myself in a different working culture, and explore new paths. This move wasn‚Äôt easy, but it helped me grow, adapt to new environments, and discover new passions. It shaped my independence, maturity, and how I approach challenges.

What drives me is my passion for data and the discipline to keep pushing until I find the right path. Through careful planning and organization, I create structure for myself that enables productivity. I don‚Äôt take things at face value‚ÄîI‚Äôm always looking for the "why" behind the process. I aim for complete, long-term solutions.

I focus on creating scalable, maintainable solutions. My background as a backend software engineer taught me the importance of high data quality. This experience made me more versatile when I transitioned back into Data Science, shifting my approach from ad-hoc scripts to a structured, end-to-end mindset.

I have experience in machine learning, computer vision, and deep learning, paired with a strong interest in DevOps and MLOps. I‚Äôm proficient with tools like Snowflake, AWS and Gitlab. I led a backend project supporting 500 weekly active users. I‚Äôve developed a custom Siamese Network to detect similarity patterns in over 3 million data points and implemented a novel Variational Autoencoder (VAE) that improved anomaly detection. My approach in a data science project is to understand the end-user and customer first and get clarity about the data.

Collaboration energizes me, especially when working in cross-functional teams. I enjoy being the bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders.. I‚Äôm not afraid to take the lead and responsibility when needed.

Outside of work, I‚Äôm passionate about football‚Äîwhether playing, watching, or analyzing it. To clear my mind, I enjoy cycling or running in the summer, and skiing or ice skating in the winter. Furthermore I‚Äôm learning both Swedish and Spanish as additional languages. I keep up with the latest developments in data and AI by reading newsletters and visiting tech websites in the evenings.

My dream is to eventually combine my passion for data and AI with football. Inspired by the Moneyball principle, I hope to one day be part of a team that uses data to drive decisions and performance in the sport.

publications.description: Fairness in recommender systems has recently received attention from researchers. Unfair recommendations have negative impact on the effectiveness of recommender systems as it may degrade users‚Äô satisfaction, loyalty, and at worst, it can lead to or perpetuate undesirable social dynamics. One of the factors that may impact fairness is calibration, the degree to which users‚Äô preferences on various item categories are reflected in the recommendations they receive.

name: Gehan F******o
about:
With over 19 years of experience in software development, I am passionate about designing and delivering innovative solutions that solve complex business challenges. My expertise lies in developing robust, scalable, and high-performance applications for web, desktop, and mobile platforms using C#.NET, Python, and a range of modern technologies. I specialize in requirement analysis, feasibility assessments, and crafting architectures for distributed, multi-threaded, and multi-layered systems.

Throughout my career, I have successfully led globally distributed teams, mentored developers, and managed projects across the full software development lifecycle (SDLC). I take pride in consistently delivering high-quality software solutions on time, even in fast-paced and high-pressure environments. My extensive experience spans cloud computing (Azure), microservices architecture, and data-driven applications, helping organizations achieve their strategic objectives.

As a technology consultant and leader, I thrive at the intersection of technical expertise and strategic insight. I enjoy mentoring teams, shaping technology strategies, and leveraging emerging trends to drive innovation and deliver exceptional value. My commitment to continuous learning ensures I stay ahead of the curve, always ready to tackle new challenges with a problem-solving mindset.

Core Skills & Expertise
* Leadership & Mentorship: Managing and mentoring software development and consultancy teams.
* Technical Consulting: Providing actionable insights and solutions to meet enterprise needs.
* Backend Development: Expertise in C#.NET, Python, VB.NET, Flask, and PHP.
* Microsoft Technologies: Deep knowledge of .NET Core, ASP.NET MVC, WEB API, WCF, Xamarin, EF, Power BI, and ML.NET.
* Cloud Computing: Designing scalable and secure solutions on Microsoft Azure.
* Microservices Architecture: Building and implementing service-oriented systems.
* Database Expertise: Advanced skills in database design, development, and optimization using tools like MongoDB and Redis.
* Workflow Automation: Developing efficient workflows and business rules engines.
* DevOps Practices: Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, testing automation, and deployment strategies.

Why Choose Me?
I combine deep technical knowledge with strategic thinking to deliver impactful solutions that drive business success. Whether architecting complex systems, mentoring teams, or advising on technology strategies, I am committed to fostering innovation and exceeding expectations.
