recommendations: Susanne Lam ‚ÄúIt is a privilege to recommend Gehan. Gehan is a technical expert‚Äîa brilliant programmer who thrives in solving complex challenges through elegantly written and highly efficient code. Gehan is the kind of guy who has been passionate about technology since childhood, constantly curious and eager to learn. Gehan stays ahead of the curve by consistently keeping up with emerging technologies and expanding his expertise in the field. On a personal level, Gehan's warmth and positive energy are contagious. He uplifts the office atmosphere with his humor and kindness, making him not just a colleague but a valued friend. As a senior team member, he has been an incredible mentor, generously sharing his knowledge and guiding me through many challenges. Whenever the team faces a roadblock, the advice is always: "Ask Gehan." I will miss having Gehan as a colleague and can‚Äôt help but envy the team that gets to work with him next. I truly hope we get the chance to work together again!‚Äù

Henrik Bj√∂rk ‚ÄúDuring my assignment as a Solution Architect at Volvo Penta, I had the pleasure of working with Gehan, a Cloud Engineering Consultant specializing in .Net on Azure. He is a hard worker who consistently delivered high-quality results at a rapid pace. Gehan's expertise in .Net is extensive. While working together, we engaged in numerous productive discussions on improving the product and making sound technical decisions. Gehan took a lot of initiative and made valuable contributions to the technical landscape. Needless to say, Gehan's contributions had a significant impact on the product. If you ever someone with deep knowledge about Azure and .Net, Gehan should be your go-to person.‚Äù

projects.description: I'm thrilled to share a project I‚Äôve been a part of the development and deployment of Uptime Backbone (UBB) and Notification Backbone (NBB) for Volvo Penta. These systems represent a big leap forward in smart connectivity and proactive maintenance for marine and industrial engine solutions. Here's what makes them game-changers:Uptime Backbone (UBB): The heart of operational excellence. UBB collects and analyzes real-time engine performance data, empowering predictive maintenance, optimized fleet management, and data-driven decision-making. It's all about minimizing downtime and maximizing productivity.Notification Backbone (NBB): The voice of the system. NBB ensures that critical information‚Äîlike alerts, diagnostics, or maintenance reminders‚Äîreaches the right people at the right time. Whether it‚Äôs a technician, operator, or fleet manager, NBB keeps everyone in the loop via customizable, real-time notifications.Together, UBB and NBB redefine customer experiences by enhancing reliability, reducing unplanned downtime, and empowering users with actionable insights. These systems are a testament to the power of connectivity and innovation in industrial and marine technology.
projects.title: Uptime Backbone (UBB) & Notification Backbone (NBB)

projects.description: GS provides a comprehensive solution for Open Source Intelligence, Web Intelligence, and Social Listening. The system allows investigators to collect information on suspects and targets, enrich existing databases and draw analytical insights from open-source information. The system is able to crawl data from multiple sources including deep web, dark web, and social media sites. An avatar management system allows furthering the reach of the system into closed networks and forums.
projects.title: GS Crawler

projects.description: Fusion is a multisource big data investigation platform. Ingest data from a myriad of sources, structured and unstructured, and apply custom analytical workflows and adaptable machine learning models to accelerate investigations. Break the silos and connect the dots to find insights and hidden links. Fusion helps track targets using multiple sensors and capabilities creating a single holistic profile of the target. It allows analysts to seamlessly move between web-based sources, SIGINT and interception, and collection capabilities from end-user devices such as mobile phones.
projects.title: GS Fusion

projects.description: ATP is a critical aircraft maintenance information. Whether in the office, at a remote location, or on the other side of the airport, the ATP Aviation Hub‚Ñ¢ mobile application makes the information available ‚Äì even when there is no internet connection. With this mobile application easy to maintenance regulatory information as well as critical compliance tracking information whenever and wherever they need it. Mobile Applications can be installed on Windows, Android, or iOS devices to access critical maintenance and regulatory content.
projects.title: ATP - Aviation Hub Mobile Application

projects.description: SKY12 School Management System is a comprehensive web-based product that automates all major aspects of school management. The system is hosted in SaaS platform, facilitating schools to make use of the system, which is delivered over the web, rather than building and maintaining infrastructure to run on-premises applications. This enables users to lower their costs by paying only for what they use, enjoy seamless and painless upgrades in functionality, easy customization, integration to tab applications and their existing data and systems. It comprises of nine modules as Admin, Planning, Staff, Student, Exam, Timetable, Attendance, Reporting and Parent-Student Portal. Admin Module is the central controller of the system where the Super Administrator of the School network can perform all system administrative tasks, including creating user roles, assigning privileges to user roles, user management, creating schools, etc. Planning Module involves the arrangement of the entire school structure. It includes all school configuration tasks, organizing the school calendar for a given academic year, and managing subjects. Staff Module facilitates the management of both academic and non-academic staff members of the school including a Subject allocation for teachers. Student Module facilitates the management of student registration, Disciplinary procedures, Student health, and Annual class allocation of students. Exam module includes organizing the Examination Schedules, Resource allocation, and Student Assessment. The timetable module offers a complete automated solution for constructing and managing the school timetable. Attendance module facilitates the management of both Student and Staff attendance, Synchronization with any existing attendance tracking system at school, and Leave management.
projects.title: SKY12

projects.description: Lilitha College (Lilitha) of Nursing has been established through the Education and Training of Nurses and Midwives Act 4 of 2003. The Inception of the college was in April 2004 and it has five (5) main campuses and thirteen satellite campuses.Lilitha has decided to take the lead in moving to a next-generation technology solution to further automate and enhance its procedures used in the capture, organization, and workflow of the extensive information that it must regularly process in University Management operation. In order to facilitate this requirement VIDLO Lilitha product has been developed which has the capability of automating and managing All operations, which are involved in running universities and colleges. The application combines a suite of applications specifically designed to bring together people, process, and technology towards improving relevance and quality of higher education. The product has different modules such as Finance, Student management, Academic Management, Examinations, and Student Portal, etc.The product has been developed as an ASP.net application and used SQL Server 2008 (R2) as the database server.
projects.title: University Management System for Lilitha Nursing College

projects.description: The Leap project was the proposed solution for Imprima to upgrade their existing Online Document Management System. The existing system was based on Classic ASP and was to be upgraded to ASP .NET using the 3.5 Framework. The system was to handle all the existing functions which were uploading and downloading documents, grouping, protection, compression, streaming and access control
projects.title: Imprima - iRooms (Online Virtual Data Rooms)

projects.description: System for RAS division to maintain documents of staff (passport scanned copies; degree certificates scanned copies etc.). The application facilitates quick search, sharing files and documents, and recover documents.
projects.title: Document Management System (DMS)

projects.description: This system provides a comprehensive solution for Insurance Brokering Companies with exclusive features, targeted for standardizing and streamlining the Insurance Broker‚Äôs operations. The system takes into consideration that the source of income for an Insurance Broker is through Commissions paid by the Insurance Company. Therefore the system keeps track of the effect to the commission during each transaction based on a policy. Taking into consideration the most frequent business handled by this system is Motor Insurance Policy; the system provides greater emphasis on the Motor Insurance related activities. But it provides generalized and highly customizable functions to undertake Non-Motor Insurance Policies as effectively as it handles Motor Policy activities.
projects.title: Insurance Brokering System with Finance (BSF)

projects.description: This system was developed for auto spare part vendors; it can handle stock management for multiple companies, the daily buying and selling values and re-order level can be checked by this system. One of the key features of the system is that it has the ability to generate a vast array of reports to be viewed by the management and the ability to generate real-time reports as all transactions are carried out online.
projects.title: Inventory Management and Stock Control System

projects.description: This system was developed for newspaper agents. The returned number of newspapers, the number of newspapers currently in stock, the total price of newspapers, the number of newspapers that will sell during the coming week and the ability for the agent to interact with multiple newspaper companies, are the main features of the system. The neural network capability in the system allows the agent to decide about the stocks that need to be purchased for the coming week. The traditional waterfall method was used throughout this project as the development methodology.
projects.title: Invoice System for Newspaper Dealers

projects.description: During the summer I had research training where I did bee population genetics in Matthew Websters group at the department of medical biochemistry and microbiology (IMBIM). I did SNP-analysis correlated to the thelytokous phenotype found in a specific population of South African bees. I also did an admixture analysis looking into the development in South America of the Africanzied honey bee.Software that I used during the project was BWA-mem, SAM-tools, Picard, PLINK, ADMIXTURE and many GATK-tools. All of the computations were performed on the computational clusters of UPPMAX.
projects.title: Research training - Bee population genetics

projects.description: I was in the Uppsala iGEM team 2018 and competed for them in Boston. Our multidisciplinary team aimed at developing a smart bacteria able to detect the presence of the deadly horse parasite Cyathostominae. This bacteria would in the future be able to serve as a tool for knowing when to distribute treatment to the horses, resulting in halting the increase in resistance the parasites have been developing against the available cures. Apart from working on the main project I was in the graphical design subgroup where we designed sponsor videos, logos etc.
projects.title: Uppsala iGEM 2018

Sometimes the compiler is the enemy, but I don‚Äôt know what I would have done otherwise. 

I have always aspired to create a product of my own, one that I‚Äôve developed from scratch and that provides genuine value. To do this, I first want to gain experience by working at great companies and understand the market of today. 

From making asteroid fighters in assembly to divide-and-conquer algorithms, I have loved university. My niche quickly became the backend part as I have always been drawn to these very logical aspects of the program. The compiler seemed to always be right and soon I learned to trust it. Now, I am so grateful for the field of coding, as it aligns perfectly with my skills and interests. 

Today I am looking for jobs in back-end development. I enjoy all parts of coding and especially in logically intense ones. I have found C# and the .NET framework most interesting. Soon, I want to be able to lead my own team where we develop the future. 

I am open to opportunities both within and outside of Sweden! Please send me a message on LinkedIn!

name: Emil B********n
about:
Gamer 4 Life!
From an early age i've had a strong interest in technology and digital, interactive systems.
This interest led me onto the path of programming and game development during gymnasium, and later during college i found an interest in AI and procedural generation. Shortly after college i also discovered an interest in programming backend systems, and i've come to love to experiment with and implement interesting game mechanics, algorithms, AI, and backend systems for web projects.
When it comes to game mechanics in particular, the more reality-challenging the better!

Working on a project together with passionate people and being able to contribute to realizing a digital, interactive system is something i find great joy in, and i always make sure to bring my "A-game" to every team and task i get to take on. Software development and playing games are the two foremost aspects of life where i feel i'm in my element.

The following are some of the software and programming languages i've interacted with and learned during the years:
* AI and procedural generation techniques:
	* Finite State Machine, Minimax, Steeringbehaviors, L-Systems, Marching Cubes, A* pathfinding, various sorting algorithms, and various dungeon/labyrinth generation algorithms.
* Unity and C#
* Unreal Engine and C++
* ASP.NET Core and SQL
* Node, ReactJS, and Javascript/Typescript.

My biggest accomplishments so far include being awarded the diploma for "Programmer of the Year" when i matriculated from gymnasium, the fact that i've acquired a bachelor's degree as well as having been a part of developing a horror game called "Forgive Me" during a college project which became decently popular.

I always look forward to being a part of and contributing to a new software project. Right now i'm in-between studies and work and i'm actively exploring the world of software development on my own with various private projects. If i seem like an interesting guy, don't hesitate to send me a message or email!

name: Per L********d
about:
I'm a software engineer with almost 30 years of experience in everything from backend/cloud systems to game development, 8 years of leadership experience, and 5 years of product management experience. Most recently I worked at Spotify for 12+ years where I helped design, build, run, and maintain large-scale backend/cloud systems as well as desktop and mobile client infrastructure for half a billion users.

I have a tremendous passion for software engineering and worked with many languages and systems throughout my career, such as C/C++, Python, Java, C#, Windows, Mac, Linux, Unix, etc. I love solving complex problems, algorithms, game development, building large-scale backend systems that run fast and reliably, and product development & design.

In my 12+ years at Spotify I had many different roles:

- As a Backend Engineer I helped architect, build and maintain many mission critical large-scale backend systems for half a billion+ users across the world.

- As a C++/Core Engineer I worked on adding new features to and improving the low level mobile infrastructure used by both iOS and Android apps.

- As a Staff Engineer/tech lead I helped set up the tech steering/strategy group for the Core Experience team at Spotify and worked on architecting and drive large tech investments and projects.

- As a Product Manager I developed, researched, launched and maintained many prominent features to hundreds of millions of users all over the world for the Core Experience team at Spotify.

My spare time is dedicated to my many hobbies such as game development, music, drawing and art, beach volleyball, photography, and travel.

projects.description: Here i built a website for a Pilates Training Studio. Client wanted a bright and fun website that at the same time showcases their professionalism and their beautiful studio. I tried my best to put effort in visual hierarchy and to have the UI & UX on point.The client had an outdated wordpress website and their own domain, so the focus was to upgrade the website and move the domain over to my Vercel hosted project. So i needed to learn everything i could about DNS settings in a very short period of time.I used ReactJS and integrated Wondr (a service they use for schedule, booking and memberships) and EmailJS for a simple contact. I got to be included in the photoshoots as well and have my input on what would work well on the website, so my curios marketing eye got a good test as well.Challenging for me to integrate services i have not used before and i had never used a user owned domain that i had to move and change/update the DNS. But overall a very fun project that i learned a lot from.

name: Lin*** Aj***
about:
Hi! 
My name is Linn√©a Ajger. I‚Äôm a frontend developer with a background as a physiotherapist. I truly love solving problems and I found a new passion in programming. It makes me happy to create clean code with a good structure, and then get direct feedback seeing the result in the browser. I really enjoy the styling part and my aim is to create beautiful things where pixel matters.

 As a physio I‚Äôve developed great communication and social skills. It‚Äôs a job about meeting people and find a way to collaborate together with the patient but also with colleagues. But I missed something in my previous work, the stimulation from solving a tricky puzzle and to have my power of change in my own hands.

I‚Äôm intrigued by the fact that as a developer you‚Äôre never done learning. There‚Äôs always new things to learn and it‚Äôs important to keep up with the industry. I‚Äôm a fast learner and I feel very satisfied with myself when I learn new things.

Who am I as a person then? 
I‚Äôm the one who loves helping others. I‚Äôm the one who is seeing more solutions than problems. I‚Äôm usually the one who smiles a lot and likes to joke around, but also have a good sense of when to be professional. I like doing activities outdoors or lifting heavy things with my fellow crossfitters. I also recently took a pottery class and that‚Äôs something I‚Äôd love to explore more! 

‚≠êÔ∏è Tech favourites: CSS, React, JavaScript, HTML

name: Sony V**********l V******e
about:
I've been in software development for over 9 years, with more than 5 years specializing in Frontend Development, where I've focused on creating intuitive digital experiences. I have completed my Masters of Science in Informatics (Digital Service Innovation) from Halmstad University, Sweden. I have done my Masters thesis in collaboration with Volvo Cars, where I have delved deep into exploring data analytics, including exploratory data analysis and predictive modeling.

My passion lies in creating user-centric interfaces that exceed expectations. I excel at leveraging my expertise to achieve significant outcomes. Whether through predictive modeling or leading frontend development initiatives aimed at enhancing user experiences, I'm dedicated to delivering impactful results.

While my primary expertise lies in frontend development, I also bring experience in backend development. I'm eager to further develop my skills in both areas and transition into a full-stack developer role. I believe that mastering both frontend and backend technologies will enable me to contribute more effectively to the complete software development lifecycle and offer comprehensive solutions to complex challenges.

Looking ahead, I am committed to furthering my contributions to the field of Software development, particularly in frontend and backend technologies. 

What sets me apart is my holistic approach to problem-solving. Beyond writing code, I have a deep understanding of business requirements and end-user needs, allowing me to develop solutions that not only meet technical specifications but also drive business growth. Additionally, my proactive attitude and ability to adapt to new technologies ensure that I stay ahead of industry trends and deliver cutting-edge solutions.

I have been honored for my leadership in guiding teams to success, my dedication to helping team members grow and succeed, and for possessing a wonderful personality that uplifts team morale. These recognitions underscore my commitment to fostering a positive and collaborative work environment, where every team member feels valued and empowered.

In summary, I offer a unique blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and a relentless drive for innovation. I am ready to tackle the challenges of tomorrow and make a lasting impact in the ever-evolving world of software development.

Don't hesitate to contact me if you think my adaptability and expertise in Software/Frontend Development can create value for your organization! The easiest way to reach me is by sending a message here on LinkedIn.
position: Full Stack Developer at Emploify AB | Thesis Researcher at Volvo |  Former Technology Lead at Infosys | Passionate Software/Full stack/Frontend Developer

projects.description: As part of my thesis project in collaboration with Volvo Cars, I endeavored to revolutionize cleaning operations of facilities through innovative data-driven approaches. Leveraging insights from diverse sources such as WiFi, sensors, and weather data, the primary objective was to optimize cleaning operations. By integrating data analytics, predictive modeling, and real-world experimentation, the project aimed to advance the state-of-the-art in cleaning operations management and contribute to more sustainable and efficient practices. Undertaken individually, I demonstrated independent research and analytical skills in exploring data analytics and predictive modeling for optimizing cleaning operations at Volvo Cars.
projects.title: Thesis on Smart Cleaning - Data driven Strategies

projects.description: As the team leader, I spearheaded the Water Management System project, aiming to revolutionize water usage and conservation practices in commercial and industrial settings. Leading a team of 5 members, I directed front-end development efforts and collaborated with cross-functional teams. Together, we delivered a hierarchical dashboard system enabling users to monitor and optimize water consumption across multiple levels of organizational hierarchy. Our primary objective was to provide organizations with a comprehensive tool to monitor, analyze, and optimize water usage, empowering users with actionable insights.
projects.title: Smart Water Management

projects.description: The Energy Management System project aimed to enhance the efficiency and usability of the existing platform by migrating from React.js to Angular. As the project lead, I oversaw the comprehensive migration process, ensuring a seamless transition while maintaining code quality and adhering to Angular best practices. I led a team of four professionals throughout the migration process, coordinating efforts to achieve our goals effectively.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Led the comprehensive migration of an existing React.js project to Angular. This involved strategizing the transition process, rewriting components, and ensuring seamless functionality transfer from React to Angular.‚Ä¢Spearheaded regular status calls to keep all stakeholders informed about the progress of the migration project‚Ä¢Managed the code review process on GitHub, ensuring adherence to Angular best practices
projects.title: Energy Management System

projects.description: As the technology lead for the Infosys Return to Workplace initiative, I spearheaded the development and implementation of a comprehensive suite of web applications aimed at facilitating a safe and efficient transition back to physical workspaces for employees amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. Leading a team of 9 professionals, I directed frontend development efforts to deliver comprehensive solutions for workplace management and safety compliance. This involved developing web applications to manage hoteling, locations, user access, conference rooms, and workspaces, ensuring optimal utilization and safety compliance.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢ Spearheaded the frontend development efforts using the Angular framework for the Infosys Return to Workplace initiative amid the COVID-19 pandemic.‚Ä¢ Developed and integrated essential modules within the admin application, including hoteling management, location management, and user management functionalities.‚Ä¢ Implemented a responsive employee application for managing conference rooms and workspaces, optimizing workplace utilization, and enhancing employee experience‚Ä¢ Organized and led status calls, ensuring effective communication with senior management to provide project updates and address concerns‚Ä¢ Served as a mentor to junior team members, offering guidance on technical aspects and best practices within the Angular framework.‚Ä¢ Conducted thorough code reviews and managed code merging processes on GitHub.‚Ä¢ Upheld code quality standards and ensured adherence to best practices, promoting a robust and maintainable codebase for the project.
projects.title: Return To Workplace

projects.description: Rail Optimizer, a groundbreaking software solution developed specifically for a logistics company, aimed to streamline logistics operations within the company network, with a specific focus on fleet management and intermodal transportation. I played a dual role, contributing to both frontend and backend development to ensure the successful implementation of this innovative solution.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Developed and integrated web applications using Angular 5 for frontend functionalities.‚Ä¢Implemented Web API services using C#.NET for backend functionalities.‚Ä¢Conducted thorough testing of Web API services using Postman to ensure reliability.‚Ä¢Actively participated in all Scrum meetings, contributing to project planning and progress tracking.
projects.title: Rail Optimizer for Logistics domain

projects.description: The Telemedicine Web & Mobile App project aimed to provide a comprehensive platform for remote healthcare services, catering to both patients and pharmacies. As a key member of the project team, I played a crucial role in the development and API integration of the responsive web and mobile app using Angular. Additionally, I actively participated in Scrum meetings and contributed to defect fixing to ensure the smooth functioning of the app. The primary objective of the Telemedicine Web & Mobile App was to enable seamless communication and interaction between patients and pharmacies for remote healthcare services.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Played a central role in the development and API integration of the responsive web/mobile app using Angular, ensuring compatibility, responsiveness, and optimal user experience across different devices and screen sizes.‚Ä¢Actively participated in Scrum meetings, contributing insights, updates, and feedback to ensure alignment with project goals and timelines‚Ä¢Identified and resolved defects and issues within the app, conducting thorough testing and debugging to maintain high-quality standards and deliver a seamless user experience for both patients and pharmacies.
projects.title: Telemedicine Web & Mobile App

projects.description: The Retail Blockworks Application was a pivotal project within the Banking and Finance domain, aimed at revolutionizing the tax filing process for individuals and businesses. Developed to streamline and simplify tax-related procedures, the project focused on creating a user-friendly platform that catered to the diverse needs of taxpayers. As part of multiple small teams handling specific modules, I contributed to both functionality enhancement and defect fixing, ensuring the successful delivery of this innovative solution.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Enhanced the application functionality according to identified requirements, contributing to its overall effectiveness and usability.‚Ä¢Identified and addressed defects within the application, utilizing Application Lifecycle Management (HPALM) for efficient defect management.‚Ä¢Coordinated with team members to resolve defects promptly, ensuring minimal disruption to project timelines and deliverables.‚Ä¢Developed comprehensive unit test cases to validate the implemented code and ensure its reliability.‚Ä¢Participated actively in peer reviews, daily status review meetings, and defect review meetings to maintain high-quality standards and project transparency.‚Ä¢Provided guidance and training to team members to foster their professional growth and enhance their skills.
projects.title: Retail Blockworks Application

projects.description: As part of a five-person team, I contributed to the Anchorage and Canadian Tobacco Tax project, a significant initiative within the retail domain. Our focus was on modernizing and optimizing the management of tobacco tax records and processes. The project involved migrating data from MS Access to SQL Server 2012 and developing robust reporting and form functionalities to streamline tax-related processes.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Led the data migration process from MS Access to SQL Server 2012, ensuring seamless transition and data integrity for the management of tobacco tax records.‚Ä¢Participated in the thorough testing of reports and forms to validate functionality and accuracy, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements specific to tobacco tax management.‚Ä¢Developed and optimized stored procedures to streamline the application's performance, facilitating efficient processing of tobacco tax data.‚Ä¢Provided ongoing support until the code was successfully moved to production, ensuring smooth deployment and uninterrupted functionality.‚Ä¢Created comprehensive documentation for newly implemented scenarios related to tobacco tax management, ensuring clarity and compliance with regulatory standards.
projects.title: Anchorage and Canadian Tobacco Tax

projects.description: Undertaken in a small company environment as a fresher, I played a pivotal role in the end-to-end development and maintenance of an e-commerce platform for SAT and ACT preparation materials as part of the e-Learning Technology initiative. This pioneering project aimed to provide comprehensive study resources through an innovative e-commerce platform, catering to the specific needs of students preparing for standardized tests. I demonstrated adaptability and rapid skill acquisition in navigating through diverse project requirements and responsibilities within the company.The platform featured intuitive navigation, user-friendly interfaces, and secure payment gateways to enhance the overall shopping experience. Regular updates and seasonal releases were incorporated to ensure the availability of the latest SAT and ACT prep materials. Additionally, I developed and deployed an independent admin application using PHP and MySQL for efficient sales tracking and management, and utilized Amazon SES for reliable promotional email delivery.Roles & Responsibilities:‚Ä¢Led end-to-end development and maintenance of the e-commerce platform, ensuring seamless user experience and secure transactions.‚Ä¢Developed an admin console utilizing PHP and MySQL to oversee sales tracking and management.‚Ä¢Implemented auto email feature using a batch file, enhancing customer engagement and retention through timely reminders.‚Ä¢Utilized Amazon SES to send promotional emails related to the product.‚Ä¢Conducted thorough testing and issue resolution to maintain software functionality and integrity.‚Ä¢Interfaced with clients to gather requirements, ensuring alignment with project goals and client expectations.
projects.title: e-Learning Technology & Auto email admin console

name: Claudio C**z
about:
I'm a junior software developer with a unique background spanning 7 years in the Portuguese army and 6 years in warehouse operations. Recently, I completed a Full Stack development course at Code Institute, mastering HTML, CSS, Python, JavaScript, and React.

During my course, I engaged in five projects, culminating in the development of a React application adept at managing tasks, events, habits, and notes. Additionally, I actively participated in hackathons, collaborating within dynamic teams to enhance both my teamwork and technical abilities.

Currently, I manage warehouse operations at an e-commerce startup, optimizing processes and collaborating with app developers to enhance our system. Simultaneously, I work part-time as a frontend developer, refining the e-commerce webpage for better user experience.

The employment involved daily reception of product samples that werechecked to further communicate any quality and fit changes to respective suppliers.Within the company, I worked with sports, outdoor, street and leisure clothes for women,men and children/ juniors. Before each new season, product specifications were drawn upbased on the designer's sketches in the programs Excel and Illustrator. In order to get abetter overview, I set up a new sorting and documentation system for all incoming samples.I was also given responsibility for product images and texts for both internal and externalbrands, which were to be published on the company's website.During the first summer at the company I took on the responsibility of managing thecompany's various departments during the holidays. experience.description_html:
After 5 weeks of field study in connection with studies, I was employed at Team Sportia as a
Design Technician. The employment involved daily reception of product samples that were
checked to further communicate any quality and fit changes to respective suppliers.
Within the company, I worked with sports, outdoor, street and leisure clothes for women,
men and children/ juniors. Before each new season, product specifications were drawn up
based on the designer's sketches in the programs Excel and Illustrator. In order to get a
better overview, I set up a new sorting and documentation system for all incoming samples.
I was also given responsibility for product images and texts for both internal and external
brands, which were to be published on the company's website.
During the first summer at the company I took on the responsibility of managing the
company's various departments during the holidays. This meant store and customer
service by phone and e-mail, teach me the Axapta software to receive and place delivery
orders to stores and simpler paperwork for the logistic and finance department.
experience.title: Design technician

about:
My name is Leo, and I am a passionate full-stack development who loves creating robust and scalable systems as well as sleek and user-friendly websites. Throughout my education, I have gained a broad range of expertise in programming, covering both backend and frontend development. I have learned to develop stable and scalable backend systems using technologies such as Java, MySQL, and Spring Boot, to name a few. Additionally, I have acquired the skills to create interactive web applications and websites utilizing modern technologies like JavaScript, React, Vue, HTML, and CSS.

Beyond my formal education, I enjoy working on personal projects where I combine my knowledge and ideas to create a finished product while simultaneously learning new techniques and skills. Currently, I am employed as a Delivery Manager at ICA, where I have developed valuable skills in customer relations, service, teamwork, and problem-solving. These experiences have helped me become a versatile and dedicated individual who excels at adapting to new environments and working effectively with others.

experience.description_html:
Under min praktik (10 veckor) på Skolverket fick jag möjlighet att delta i ett spännande projekt där jag utvecklade en applikation för att jämföra gymnasieskolor. Projektet gav mig praktisk erfarenhet i flera moderna teknologier och arbetsmetoder, vilket gjorde praktiken både givande och lärorik.

En del av arbetet innefattade att använda Sitevision och Gitlab för versionshantering och samarbete i projektet. Jag använde också React-ramverket med Typescript för att utveckla applikationens gränssnitt, där jag skapade komponenter och implementerade funktionalitet samt använde jag mig av Jest för enhetstester för att säkerställa att alla komponenter fungerar som de ska. För att säkerställ en professionell och användarvänlig design använde jag SCSS för att styla komponenterna och skapa en responsiv layout.

Under denna period lärde jag mig mycket om hur det är att arbeta som utvecklare i ett team. Jag fick förståelse för hur varje del av projektet är beroende av varandra, och hur viktigt det är att kunna samarbeta effektivt. Genom att använda Jira som ett verktyg för sprintplanering och ärendehantering, fick jag praktiskt erfarenhet av hur man planerar, organiserar och prioriterar arbetsuppgifter. Jag lärde mig också hur man skapar och hanterar tickets i Jira för att hålla koll på framstegen och säkerställa att projektet går framåt enligt tidsplanen.

Denna praktik har inte bara stärkt mina tekniska färdigheter inom utveckling och design, utan även gett mig värdefull insikt i hur det dagliga arbetet fungerar i ett professionellt utvecklingsteam, där kommunikation och samarbete är centrala för framgång.

positions.description: http://bit.ly/tomasbylander-cvAs the development manager for three sub-teams (automation, mobile device and ALM), my main task is to help, assist and manage my team of 25 engineers (employees and consultants), oversee the daily operations and perform a wide range of duties that correspond to the team. One-to-one meetings, strategy discussions, team meetings, interviews, budget discussions, salary reviews; all tasks are part of the responsibilities in the role of team manager. Due to my technical background and just my plain curiosity and love for IT, I am also asked to be involved in a lot of technical discussions, especially related to CI/CD and test automation. I take part in projects and pre-studies, more often than not connected to business impact, through interacting with external vendors as well as internal consultants and employees. Adding to this, being part of a centralized organization as TestCenter is at IKEA, I also try to work on process improvement for the organization. I drove the proof of concept and implementation of Confluence, Slack and JIRA, tools that today are used as an everyday tool at TestCenter.

positions.description_html:
Responsible for the creation and implementation of a testable solution, high level design and securing the efficient application(s) test coverage, test environment including service virtualization, test data, test strategies, test automation and test process are considered in the test solution. In the context of one or more domains across the integrated solution, it includes assessment of requirements from a test perspective and secure that high level and detailed designs are coherent and have sufficient quality to enable efficient test design and execution.

Lead test solution activities within and across the domain(s) including risk based testing assessments, early test estimation and scope (e.g. Non-functional requirements review). Acts as the main contributor to the solutioning process from test perspective and provide expertise for roadmaps, pre-studies and design or test workshops including any test process tailoring decisions and strategies that can impact the testing effectiveness.

Steer projects to follow decided architecture, process standards, test strategies and ensure test coverage and testability of the functional and non-functional requirements in the development of the solution

name: Sushil K***r S***h
about:
Senior Technical Lead having more than 14 years of experience in Software application design, development and maintenance of numerous web-based applications and back-end processes. My roles and responsibility starts from application requirement gathering , technical spec writing , system design, coding ,unit testing , code review, mentoring/leading to team, creating automatic build and release pipelines and end to end application development and production support using Agile SAFe way of working. 

I have strong experience in migrating legacy monolithically architecture Dot.Net based application and SQL database into modern microservice based application , Identity server authentication setup and migrating monolithically database table data into new microservice based database table data.

I have worked 2 years as application security coach to guide team to implement Threat Modeling, ASVS and OWASP Top 10 security requirements in application for to make application more secure .  Our application security team has done analysis/ worked on of various SAST , DAST , SCA , IAST tools and integrated SAST (SonarQube) , SCA(WhiteSource Bolt) and DAST(OWSP ZAP) tools in application Azure DevOps build pipeline . 

Specialties: Software design and development using Angular 8 , HTML5 , CSS3 , Rest API's , ASP.Net 4.0 and 4.5 with C#, VB.Net, N-tier, MVC, Ajax, Web Service, WCF,  Web designing, Crystal Report 8.0, MS SQL 2015, Oracle 11g, Git , CVS, VSS, TFS, SVN.

about:
As a Regulatory Implementation Manager and Core Software Developer at Oncodia AB, I have been applying my MSc in Engineering/Biotechnology and my extensive experience in Life Science, MedTech, and academia to ensure the quality and safety of our products and services. I have been working at Oncodia AB for over five years, and I am passionate about developing and implementing solutions that improve cancer diagnostics and treatment.

At Oncodia I was responsible for leading and coordinating the regulatory affairs and quality assurance activities related to our in vitro diagnostic medical devices (IVDs). I have successfully managed multiple projects, from ideation to validation, involving bioinformatics, software development and data analysis. I have also been instrumental in establishing and maintaining our quality management system (QMS) and preparing for the transition to the new IVDR regulation.

about:
I am an aspiring Software Development Engineer with a broad range of technical skills and strong interpersonal abilities.

Languages: Python, C, C++, JavaScript, R

Operating Systems: Linux, Windows, macOS

I am passionate about solving complex problems and building scalable applications. In addition to my technical expertise, I am also skilled at presentations, communication, strategic planning, leadership, and teamwork, making me an effective contributor in collaborative settings.

With a focus on cloud computing, web development, and data science, I am eager to apply my skills, contribute to innovative projects, and continue growing as a Software Development Engineer.

If you're looking for a dedicated and versatile professional with a blend of technical knowledge and excellent communication skills, let‚Äôs connect!
position: Aspiring Software Development Engineer | Machine Learning Enthusiast | Full-Stack Developer (ReactJS, Node.js, React Native) | AWS | Python & DSA Problem-Solver

experience.description: As part of my bachelor‚Äôs thesis, I am conducting research on "Identifying Abnormalities in Heart Sound Data Using Machine Learning" in collaboration with Rcupe Lifesciences private limited. This research focuses on developing an acoustic model of the heart to map heart sound profiles and detect abnormalities. I apply signal processing techniques to preprocess heart sound data for machine learning analysis and explore personalized learning models for early diagnosis of heart conditions. Using publicly available heart sound datasets, I train and validate ML models to improve accuracy and reliability. This collaboration aims to develop a visual acoustic model for heart function analysis, contributing to AI-driven advancements in medical diagnostics.

I apply signal processing techniques to preprocess heart sound data for machine learning analysis and explore personalized learning models for early diagnosis of heart conditions. Using publicly available heart sound datasets, I train and validate ML models to improve accuracy and reliability. This collaboration aims to develop a visual acoustic model for heart function analysis, contributing to AI-driven advancements in medical diagnostics.

name: Sonadri T****a M****a
about:
As a Senior Consultant at LTTS, I specialize in Robotic Process Automation (RPA) while also leveraging my background in CAD automation. I utilize tools like UiPath to optimize and automate business processes, delivering high-quality solutions for clients across various industries, including SCHIENDLER (Germany), VESTAS (Denmark), UTC CARRIER (USA), and CATERPILLAR (USA).

I hold a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science from the National Institute of Science and Technology (NIST), Berhampur, which I completed in 2015. In addition to my RPA certification, I have experience in CAD automation and customization, including PDM-Windchill integration using tools such as the CREO toolkit and NX.

My passion for learning drives me to continuously explore new technologies and programming languages. I utilize JIRA for project management, ensuring tasks are organized and progress is tracked. My goal is to create innovative solutions that deliver real value to businesses and enhance the user experience.

about:
As a Technical Project Manager at Svea Renewable Solar AB, I apply my 14+ years of IT industry experience and my core skills of leading and delivering projects using agile methodologies. I have a proven track record of building and mentoring self-motivated and self-challenging teams that deliver high-quality results.  I am goal-oriented and strive to provide my best in every aspect of my work. 

My technical skills include designing and implementing backend systems and micro-services using Java, YAML, Spring, and other technologies, as well as developing front-end widgets and products using React/Redux, JavaScript, ES6, and knockout. I also oversee the code review, software deployment, and quality assurance processes. I collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and clients to ensure the alignment of the project scope, goals, and expectations. I am always eager to learn new skills and technologies, and to promote a growth mindset within my team and organization.

recommendations: Sonali Aher ‚ÄúI have worked closely with Priyam. During our time working together at Amdocs ,she served as my team lead, and I can confidently say that she excelled in the role. Priyam possesses an exceptional blend of technical expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to excellence. As a team lead, she consistently demonstrated strong organizational abilities, effectively delegating tasks, and guiding the team towards successful project outcomes. Her proactive approach to problem-solving and willingness to mentor junior team members greatly contributed to the overall success of our projects. In addition to her leadership qualities, Priyam is an outstanding developer. She has a deep understanding of various programming languages and technologies, and her attention to detail is unparalleled. She consistently delivered high-quality code and was always willing to share her knowledge and expertise with others. Moreover, Priyam is a pleasure to work with.Her positive attitude, strong work ethic, and ability to collaborate effectively make her a valuable asset to any team.‚Äù

Ajay Shenoy ‚ÄúPriyam worked with me in two different assignments in Amdocs. In the first, I had recently moved to lead the unit where she was working as a Team Lead. As a Team Lead, Priyam was very strong with SAFe processes and had a very good command on the functionality in the project. Her leadership and collaboration with the other Scrum teams made her stand out as an outstanding Scrum master. The second instance was in a completely different team where we were looking for a strong leader to manage the team and project. I immediately thought of Priyam and had her join this project. Once again, Priyam did a splendid job. The team always looked up to her for her leadership and mentoring. Its been a great pleasure to work with her and she will be an asset in any organization she is a part of.‚Äù
